block.p: Colleen Ann Adams, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Adams of Summit, N.J., was married yesterday to Jesse H. Lawrence III, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Jr. of Washington Township, N.J. The Rev. Earle Markey, a retired dean of the College of the Holy Cross, performed the ceremony at St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church in Short Hills, N.J.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She owns NJWeddingPlanner.com, an online wedding guide for New Jersey, and is an editor of Style.com, the Web site for Vogue magazine in New York. She graduated from Boston College.

Colleen Ann Adams, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Adams of Summit, N.J., was married yesterday to Jesse H. Lawrence III, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Jr. of Washington Township, N.J. The Rev. Earle Markey, a retired dean of the College of the Holy Cross, performed the ceremony at St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church in Short Hills, N.J.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She owns NJWeddingPlanner.com, an online wedding guide for New Jersey, and is an editor of Style.com, the Web site for Vogue magazine in New York. She graduated from Boston College.

Her father, who retired as a senior vice president and the deputy general counsel of Chase Bank in New York, is now a partner in Kelley, Drye & Warren, a New York law firm. He is also on the board of the Partnership for the Homeless in New York. Her mother, Kelley Adams, retired as the director of Youth Employment Services, a nonprofit organization in Summit.

The bridegroom, 29, works in Jersey City as an assistant vice president in the legal department of the Pershing division of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities. He graduated from Moravian College and is studying for a law degree at Fordham University. His mother, Marcia Lawrence, is the director of box office sales at the Growing Stage, a nonprofit children's theater group in Netcong, N.J. His father is a vice president in the Flemington, N.J., offices of the Commerce Bank, managing the bank's relationships with state, county and municipal governments.
